attributes.action: Acknowledge 'secondary modern' schools are created by grammar schools.
attributes.background: The government want to create new grammar schools but say 'secondary modern' schools will not exist. Schools surrounding grammar schools can not contain a full range of pupils of all abilities, this means they are are not truly 'comprehensive' schools. I want this difference officially acknowledged.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently 163 grammar schools selecting high ability pupils and 400/500 schools with low/medium ability pupil intakes as a result. These 'secondary modern' schools can not perform in the same way as a comprehensive school when the balance of pupils is so different.

Please sign this petition to ask the Department for Education to identify these schools and classify them as 'secondary moderns' or similar new name. This will help us research these schools properly before there are more.

attributes.action: Fund Research into Fibromyalgia
attributes.background:
Fibromyalgia, also called fibromyalgia syndrome (FMS), is a long-term condition that causes pain all over the body.
At present there are no known causes or cure. 
Fibromyalgia can be an invisible illness. Please take 30 seconds to sign this petition.

attributes.action: Don't include housing benefit in the benifits cap
attributes.background: The problem with the benifit cap is that if you are in a private let your weekly rent is much higher than if you are in a council or housing association house some family's could have to pay out as much as £150 a week to make up the short fall leaving many in a very bad situation

attributes.action: Get the uk goverment to give a larger budget for uk road maintenance
attributes.background: Years of underfunding has left uk roads in a severely poor state, leaving them dangerous in areas

attributes.action: Carers allowance,Caring for loved ones,by right even if claiming a State Pension
attributes.background: Mandy Bayliffe wanted " The Carers Charter " to protect all Carers from cuts and provide a framework of support via community care free at the point of need. Respite , home support and even sitting Services exempt from any charges or assessment. Many Carers die of exhaustion ,so we have to act now.
attributes.additional_details: There are almost 1.5 million Carers at home who cannot claim the allowance because they are in receipt of a State Pension, which most paid through employment. Go to www.carersassociation.info which shows all the stats in care. The allowance must be paid free of tax or any benefit assessments as with PIPS , when claiming Pension credits or Housing benefits . Child Carers must receive Education credits for when they may wish to move on to College on University . This will help reduce their fees .

attributes.action: Change the age to 25 for the sale of Fireworks
attributes.background: If the law was to change to make it illegal to sell to anyone under 25, I'm confident the constant noise on non celebrating days (Fireworks nt, Diwali & New Year's Eve) would dwindle away. Fireworks started 22/10 until 10/12 & back again 24/12 in Dagenham. They're a nuisance especially to Pets.
attributes.additional_details:
How many reports have we seen this year alone about children being injured by other children launching fireworks at them? As usual to many.
Why are supermarkets allowed to advertise "sales" on Fireworks from 7/11/16? 
In this day & age why can't fireworks be made to make minimal noise?

attributes.action: Can you make funding available to GB Baseball & Softball for the 2020 Olympics?
attributes.background: With the announcement by the Olympic Organisation Committee, the sports of Baseball and Softball will be reinstated at the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo, Japan. There is over 21,000 people, youth, adult, females and males registered with the BBF & BSF and British Baseball Softball United Kingdom, who play.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a wonderful Baseball/Softball  Complex at Farnham Park, Slough. Where the games of both sports are held/played throughout the summer months.
There is also the governing bodies for Baseball and Softball.
The British Baseball Federation for baseball. (BBF)
The British Softball Federation. (BSF)
The British Baseball Softball United Kingdom. (BSUK)
The BSUK is the development  group for British Baseball and Softball.

attributes.action: Remove all subsidies for fossil fuels, use them to subsidise renewable energy.
attributes.background: It's impossible for the government to simultaneously state their commitment to combating climate change and subsidise fossil fuels to the extent that they do. The amount of money spent on renewable energy is meanwhile decreasing. Spending more on renewable's is the only way to show real commitment.
attributes.additional_details: Subsidies for fossil fuels which approach £6 billion a year are being given to companies which generate profits in the hundreds of millions. That money is far better used to subsidies to production and implementation of renewable energies or to subsidies the household energy bills. There is an estimated 26.7 million households in the UK, the money could be used to decrease the annual energy bill by £224. Stop giving to the rich, start giving to the people.

attributes.action: Amend the Care Act (s73) 2014 which fails to protect private paying patients
attributes.background: I was booked for elective day surgery in a Private Hospital but unfortunately, the device was placed incorrectly that has resulted in horrendous physical injuries. The Private Hospital is not liable and the Surgeon denied misplacement that was not discovered until years later.
attributes.additional_details: No tests were offered to ascertain if the device was displaced as I had this surgical procedure privately. I had to vigorously research what tests were needed to identify misplacement and I eventually learnt that a volume and gadolinium MRI would be the only source. These tests were eventually done after much persistence that finally illustrated incorrect placement that has caused me physical injuries and lost career. Members of the public are under the assumption that private paying patients will always be protected but the Care Act 2014 has never protected this category of patients; this Act needs amending to ensure  all of the public are protected irrespective of fee source.

attributes.action: Provide free prescriptions for those suffering lifelong / incurable conditions
attributes.background: It is unfair that people who have no other option but to take medication for the rest of their lives, due to suffering from lifelong / incurable diseases, conditions or syndromes (such as: arthritis, asthma, heart conditions, etc.) have to pay for their prescriptions until they reach the age of 60.
attributes.additional_details:
Insulin for diabetes sufferers is free, so medication for ALL incurable diseases should also be free of charge.

Hard working tax payers who suffer from such conditions, have to pay for their prescriptions, whereas citizens on JSA can get theirs free of charge. This simply does not make sense.

£8.40 may not seem expensive, but when you are being prescribed 4 different medications per month for the same condition, this amounts to over £400 per year without a pre-paid exemption card.

attributes.action: Exempt all properties with a broadband speed <10 Mbps from Council Tax
attributes.background: Broadband is an essential service, but due to local and central government decisions, many millions of people do not have sufficient access.  A lack of good broadband makes property unsaleable, i.e. essentially worthless, and so should not be subject to Council Tax.
attributes.additional_details: Various government initiatives have failed to provide the necessary service to all, indeed they have been specifically excluded from the programmes.  The option to move is not available with low speeds, and this disadvantage should be recompensed through exemption from Council Tax.  The USO is still some years away, by which time further improvements in speed will be required,  Therefore, the 10Mbps rate should double every 2 years in line with Nielsen's Law of Internet Bandwidth.

attributes.action: Fully regulate Counselling and Psychotherapy, to properly protect the public.
attributes.background:
Anyone can call themselves "counsellor" or "psychotherapist", even with no qualifications at all.

Such people are a potentially fatal danger to clients, yet are currently free to practise.

There are societies to belong to, accreditations to gain and registers to join, but all are optional.
attributes.additional_details:
Successive governments have promised to regulate counselling for over a decade, but none have done so.

The "Accredited Register" scheme was created in 2013, and is like "CORGI" for counsellors. It sets minimum standards of training, insurance etc. However, you don't have to join a register and clients do not necessarily even know of its existence.

Regulation would protect the titles "counsellor" and "psychotherapist" and prevent those who do not meet minimum safety standards from practising.

attributes.action: Make the BBC a subscription-only channel and abolish the TV licence.
attributes.background: In 2016, people should not be forced to have a TV licence when they may not watch BBC programming. BBC could become a subscription-only channel akin to HBO (US) or a streaming service like Netflix.

attributes.action: Debate whether self-regulation of the press is adequate.
attributes.background: The UK press is constantly coming under fire for misrepresenting stories and misleading the public with inflammatory opinion pieces that purport to be news items.
attributes.additional_details:
“the press is given significant and special rights in this country ... With these rights, however, come responsibilities to the public interest: to respect the truth, to obey the law and to uphold the rights and liberties of individuals. In short, to honour the very principles proclaimed and articulated by the industry itself (and to a large degree reflected in the Editors’ Code of Practice)”.
- Sir Brian Leveson

Some newspapers are clearly failing to 'respect the truth'.

attributes.action: Screening and training for mobility scooters especially for class 3
attributes.background: There are 300,000 mobility users in England and Wales. There were 208 accidents in 2014-2015, 46 serious injuries, and 9 deaths. Class 3 mobility scooters can use the road up to 8mph, need TAX and at present, only voluntary insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
Training is needed for cars and motorcycles that use the highways but no training is needed for mobility scooters. AM Hefin David and AM Julie Morgan are in agreement that training should be given. Compulsory training will help reduce accident rates and make the users more confident and independent which will help with well-being. Statistics are being looked into to make insurance mandatory but not training. ROSPA say training should be given but not necessary!

Screening should also be done by a doctor or medical professional before buying a mobility scooter. This will ensure that people have the physical and mental capacity required to safely use a scooter, such as adequate vision.

attributes.action: Dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a new appointment process
attributes.background: We are in a situation where the house of commons appears to not represent the working class people of Great Britain. It is seen by most working class people to be an extension of the House of Lords. We need a balance of wealthy people and poor people to correctly govern the UK.
attributes.additional_details: At present we have no balance, both houses are full of highly educated individuals most from privileged backgrounds.To restore balance we need a house to represent the not so fortunate of the UK i.e low paid workers, people who live in poorer areas,  people without an education, people without the chance to change their lives. I propose we dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a cross section of society who are selected in much the same way we already make selections for Jury service.

attributes.action: Bring March into the light
attributes.background: Simple as this - put the clocks forward at the end of Feb instead of March.  It'll still be bright for the morning commute & school run and we'll gain an hour on the evenings, shortening those winter blues. It'll be good for the economy too. Win Win!

attributes.action: Make the A420 between Oxford and Swindon a dual carriageway.
attributes.background: The A420 between Oxford and Swindon is too busy  It is the main A road shortcut to the south west.  The alternative route is 19 miles longer down the A34 and the M4.  It badly needs dualling.  The proposed trunk road between Cambridge and Oxford should extended to Swindon via the A420 corridor
attributes.additional_details: The A420 between Oxford and Swindon is too busy  It is the main A road shortcut to the south west.  The alternative route is 19 miles longer down the A34 and the M4.  It badly needs dualling.  The proposed trunk road between Cambridge and Oxford should extended to Swindon via the A420 corridor

attributes.action: Government should not delay initiating secession because of Germans and French
attributes.background:
Delaying Article 50 because of German and French General Elections in 2017 is a political ruse on the part of Theresa May as the negotiations will not be affected by either result.

There is no reason why negotiations cannot start because a change will be to our advantage and make them easier.
attributes.additional_details:
At present, the two most formidable opponents of Britain in any post Brexit deal will be Merkel and Hollande.  That is the worst case scenario.

If Merkel is displaced, it will likely be by the election of candidates from the AfD.  If Hollande is displaced, it will likely be by the Front Nationale.  In both cases, they are highly Eurosceptical Parties and therefore unlikely to make it difficult for a British withdrawal. They are far more likely to give a good deal for us than at present.

attributes.action: To make the use of the word "midget" a hate crime.
attributes.background: The use of the word "midget" is used as a hate crime directed at people of short stature. People with restricted growth, frequently experience others insulting them either directly or indirectly with the inappropriate word "midget". This must stop! It is cruel and vile and has no place in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Restricted growth is commonly described as having a final adult height of 4’10” or less due to a medical condition.
Most people who have restricted growth have it due to a genetic condition. There are estimated to be several hundred conditions that can cause restricted growth, these can cause proportionate or disproportionate, such as Achondroplasia, restricted growth.

attributes.action: Incentivise broadband providers, only pay for the broad band you get
attributes.background: Provider use the phrase ‘up to’ so there is no incentive for them to improve the speed or systems to provide what you are paying for.  e.g  speed quoted at 20 Mbs and you get 10 Mbs then you would only pay half the cost and so on. Providers would then need to tell the truth on broad band speeds.

attributes.action: Stop Plans to Close and Franchise 37 Crown Post Office Branches
attributes.background: The Post Office has announced it will close 37 of its Crown Post Office branches and seeking to franchise them into existing retailers. This risks 427 jobs; loss in services, accessibility; as well as having a detrimental effect on local high streets. These community assets must be protected.

attributes.action: Give the Welsh people a referendum on whether to keep the Welsh Assembly or not
attributes.background: Before the Welsh Assembly are given any more powers, the people of Wales should be consulted on whether they wish to continue with devolution.
attributes.additional_details: We wish to have a simple yes or no question on continuing devolution put to the Welsh people.

attributes.action: Give more funding into the research of mental health especially anxiety.
attributes.background: People go undiagnosed or even wrongly diagnosed with anxiety and depression every day in the UK. We need more funding into the research and better treatments. I would also like potential financial support for those with anxiety who cannot work.

attributes.action: Suspend hospital fines for breaches in 4h waits in Emergency Departments
attributes.background: The Standard Contract for NHS Providers in 2015-16 charges hospitals £120 for every breach of the 4h wait times over the target in Emergency Departments. With unprecedented pressure on Emergency Departments currently this is an absurd system of punishing hospitals for being busy.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Health Committee "Winter pressure in accident and emergency departments Third Report of Session 2016–17" demonstrates that compliance with 4h targets plummets every winter (85% in 2015, 80% in 2016) and demand is currently higher than ever. Hospitals are paying the price of chronic government underfunding of Primary Care and Community Care, and to financially penalise hospitals for flawed government policy is clearly absurd.

attributes.action: demolish Devolution powers in the UK
attributes.background: I am petitioning to get rid of Devolution powers in the UK as it has failed. All powers should be returned to Westminster for the good of the UK union

attributes.action: Save Dunelm House (Durham Uni student union), by giving it Grade II listing.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State has refused an application from Historic England for Grade II listing. The granting of a Certificate of Immunity is now being considered with the intention that the building be demolished. We would like the Secretary to reconsider Grade II listing status.
attributes.additional_details:
It won both a Civic Trust award and the RIBA Bronze Medal 1966. The building has subsequently been praised many times. It needs to be saved as a key piece of architectural herritage. 

Catherine Croft, Director of C20 Society: “We consider Dunelm House to be a remarkably intact survivor of its era...  ...We are extremely disappointed that the Minister has chosen to disregard the view of her heritage advisers (Historic England) and the Society in making this decision.”

attributes.action: Dogs to be kept on leads whilst on sports fields
attributes.background:
On ongoing issue in our society is dog walkers allowing their dogs to run freely over sporting pitches, i.e rugby, football, cricket...
At times these dogs will release on the pitches and owners will ignore the excrement and not pick it up, thus providing a huge risk to those who play on them
attributes.additional_details:
Sporting pitches experience usage from a variety of different people - the problem of dog walkers allowing their dogs to be off their lead is that they are free to excrement wherever, the majority of the time, without the owner knowing.
The danger of this on sporting pitches is that it increases the risk of a child or adult getting the faeces in their eyes leading to several physical and health risks such as going blind.

Please help stop this and provide some respect for our sportsman.

attributes.action: Make FREE  temporary housing provisions for the homeless and support accessible
attributes.background: I want the government to make FREE temporary housing provisions available and accessible throughout the UK and give our homeless support to find permanent housing, lifestyles support such as counselling so they can regain a functioning position within society again
attributes.additional_details: More and More homeless are appearing on the streets of the UK, some have lost everything and have nowhere to turn so do the best they can by sleeping on the streets and begging , some are war veterans who have fought then been cast to one side as they as if a person is expendable, so turn to drugs and alcohol to fade out the pain. Homelessness is not normal and these people need support and not to be cast aside, ignored, left to freeze to death on the street or forced into crime to survive.

attributes.action: Ban Sodium Fluoride from our tap water
attributes.background: Sodium Fluoride is not natural, it is man made. Do not get this mixed up with calcium fluoride which is natural and can be found in soil. Sodium fluoride has not been scientificly tested for long term affects or if it even helps prevent tooth decay like we get told it does.
attributes.additional_details: Fluoride has been seen to cause alot of diseases such as cancer. https://fluoridealert.org/issues/health/ check it out for yourselves via the link above. Sodium fluoride is mostly found in the pineal gland after being indigested, which leads to a lowered IQ of the person consuming it. Unfortunately, the damaged caused by sodium fluoride can not be reversed. However we can stop making it worse and avoid the affects by stopping drinking it everyday in our tap water.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for shops to tell customers that they sell real fur
attributes.background: Many people believe that the fur industry is a thing of the past and is no longer 'fashionable,' however this is far from the truth. While it has been illegal since 2002 to farm animals for fur in the UK, it is still able to be imported, making it a £500 million industry in the UK every year.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.animalaid.org.uk/images/pdf/factfiles/fur.pdf

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/11/25/faux-fur-or-real_n_8648146.html

http://www.peta.org.uk/issues/animals-not-wear/fur-trade/

attributes.action: Preserve the UK bat population by banning wind farms
attributes.background: All species of UK bats are protected by the law. Wind farms are killing thousands of them each year.Bats have been around for 30 million years able to fly without the risk of colliding with spinning objects. They deactivate their sonar when near turbines and are attracted to the bugs drawn to them.
attributes.additional_details:
At 29 of the 46 UK wind farms examined 194 were killed monthly- a likely gross underestimate. Carried over to the 6,954 onshore turbines the carnage is tens of thousands.
Dr Lintott suggests turning off turbines during high risk periods. 
On October 2016 227 megawatts (just 0.6% of the 36,759 mW being used) was from turbines, 70%from coal; 21% nuclear; 8% from abroad.
We need forms of reliable renewable energy to deliver electricity at competitive prices that do not devastate the bat population.

attributes.action: Ask retailers to not automatically issue receipts but instead give us an option.
attributes.background:
It is estimated that 12 BILLION receipts are issued in the UK alone each year and most end up in the bin.
By opting to not have your receipt you could help save Rainforests from deforestation, reduce waste, reduce oil and water consumption and help conserve this planet. Retailers also reduce costs.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no requirement under the sale and supply of goods act 1994 act to supply a receipt to prove that a contract exists between buyer and seller, nor is there any requirement to provide physical evidence of any kind, except for the faulty goods/purchase. 

Retailers would also save thousands of pounds in reduced costs.

attributes.action: Require all local councils in England to use LED bulbs in street lights.
attributes.background: Sodium lighting is commonplace in British towns and cities. These orange lights cause a large amount of light pollution and make it difficult for most of us to see a full starry sky [1]. A switch to Amber LED lighting would improve these conditions greatly and would also be more energy efficient [2]
attributes.additional_details:
1. http://nightblight.cpre.org.uk/maps/ - The light pollution map for the UK 
2. http://www1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/publications/pdfs/alliances/outdoor_area_lighting.pdf - The American "Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy'"s report on new LED installation. 
- On the topic of Amber LED: In this case amber is the suggested colour as dimming the LEDs is the key in reducing light pollution emmisions, it also reduces blue-light exposure. http://darksky.org/lighting/led-practical-guide/

attributes.action: Help more young people and Adults with Autism into Employment.
attributes.background: I have a autistic spectrum condition and I have managed with support into gradual full time employment. Just because we have Autism doesn't make us incapable or means we can't work like any other person.

attributes.action: The Abolition of the Monarchy to be in effect as soon as possible
attributes.background:
We the undersigned, want to abolish the Monarchy due to many reasons.

Mainly due to them being out of touch with the majority of the public in the 21st Century, their unaccountability and constantly showing us how unequal we are in this country we call a democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The Monarchy still retains a lot of political power for an establishment that is unelected, being able to influence our laws on a daily basis, this is well known.
The Monarch retains the powers to appoint and dismiss Prime Ministers that we elect by a democratic majority whenever they choose, the last time this happened was in 1974.
Officially, we are subjects and not citizens of this country from the day we are born.
Also, we spend far too much on the Monarchy, this money could be spent better.

attributes.action: Don't force hard working council tenants to pay more rent
attributes.background: George Osborne wants to enforce the law, that if you earn a household income of £30,000 or more (£40,000 in London) you will have to pay equivalent of the private renting sector as of April 2017. He describes it as the 'rich' will no longer have the privilege. Some rents will increase by 300%
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3149748/Osborne-ban-cheap-rents-middle-class-council-tenants-340-000-earning-30-000-pay-market-rate.html

I understand the cut backs are needed, however this is forcing hard working people out of their homes, becoming homeless or being forced onto benefits. The £30,000 household income should not fall into the category of the 'rich' (this is only £15,000 each!  Its encouraging not to work and earn more, but to earn less!

attributes.action: Ban Dustbin lorries from operating between the school-run and rush hours
attributes.background: Dustbin lorries are a major obstruction during school-run and rush hours. it causes chaos and leads to workers and children being late at school/work and should be banned during the hours of 8:30am-9:30am working days
attributes.additional_details: We all know the frustration first thing in the morning when you rushing to work or dropping off your children at school and being stuck 20-30 minutes and then get the telling off! why are you late again? So we are asking throughout this one hour that they should operate only in main roads.

attributes.action: Allow smoking pubs or smoking rooms in certain pubs.
attributes.background: I think landlords/lady's should be able to turn there pubs into smoking or non smoking pubs. As we know pubs are closing everyday and this I believe it due to the smoking ban. If we had both smoking and non smoking it then would be down to the individual which pub they decided to go in.
attributes.additional_details: From 2007 smoking was banned in all public houses. Since this has happened thousands of small family run pubs have been closed down and never reopened. Local communities are suffering through this and so are the owners of the pubs. Allowing a smoking room would be a great space to go for a cigarette allowing people who don't smoke to be well away from it, or make some pubs smoking (at a charge made by government) so that people then have a choice which pub to attend

attributes.action: Make it Compulsory for Bus/Taxi Road lanes Surfaces be Colour Coded
attributes.background: Don't you hate it when you're away from home in unfamiliar surroundings then drive down a Bus/Taxi Land not knowing because it's not displayed properly then getting a fine.
attributes.additional_details: Get road surface colour coded where necessary

attributes.action: Postpone the revised GCSE in Maths and English set to be taken this summer.
attributes.background: Current Year 11 pupils who are due to sit the revised GCSE exams this summer in Maths and English have attained well below their expected previous grades in recent mock examinations.  This is due to the escalated rate in which the revised curriculum has been introduced.
attributes.additional_details: I am a primary school teacher and the director of private day nurseries but more importantly a parent of a Year 11 pupil.

attributes.action: Make the government provide the funding that the NHS and social care need
attributes.background: The NHS and social care under the conservatives has taken huge cuts. This has put huge strain on the NHS with the Red Cross deeming it a "humanitarian crisis". People are dying waiting on trolleys in hospital for beds that are not available.
attributes.additional_details: People are waiting up to 12 hours to be seen in A&E, when the target is four hours. Old people spend weeks in hospital beds as there is no social care to treat them at home. People's lives are at risk and the conservative government are doing nothing about it. I hearby call that PM Theresa May and health secretary Jeremy Hunt provide the funding that is desperately needed. This demands action and it needs it now. We cannot put people's lives at risk, this is not acceptable. They must act now.

attributes.action: Remove the powers local authorities have to switch off street lights at  night.
attributes.background: Several authorities have switched off street lights at night, regardless of possible crime and safety consequences. The latest is Surrey County Council, to save £210,000 a year, a mere pittance in relative terms, and an amount that could surely be saved by, for example, axing the Chief Exec post.

attributes.action: Businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on.
attributes.background:
Its time to create a law that all businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on. 
If everyone does it we can beat the myth that open doors in winter are welcoming, and we can do our part to cut our heating bills and contribute to saving the environment at the same time.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of energy drinks to children under 18
attributes.background: The World Health Organisation carried out a review of the literature surrounding energy drinks & found most of potential health risks are related to the caffeine content. In Sweden they are restricted to being sold in pharmacies & are not sold to under 15's.
attributes.additional_details: This information came from NHS choices 2014 (warnings issued over energy drinks) They are likely to become a serious public health issue in the future if they are not more heavily regulated.

attributes.action: Change Immigration rules for non eu partners.
attributes.background:
Get rid of the financial requirements so that non eu partners can able to stay and work in the uk.
The only requirements need to be married or have a family with british national.
However, both of them can not claim any benefits or funds for 2 years.
attributes.additional_details:
I am british and married with japanese national.  My spouse can not stay and work in the uk because we can not  meet financial requirements. 
It's very unfair system for british national with non eu partners.

attributes.action: Establish Hallowe'en  (31st October) as an annual national statutory holiday.
attributes.background: Hallowe'en has grown in popularity in the UK as a non-religious, community event.  This celebration encourages creativity as children make costumes & characters. Trick-or-treating encourages people to get out into their neighbourhoods and enjoy a home-made, creative festival together.
attributes.additional_details:
There are no other autumn holidays in the UK and would occur at a midpoint between the August Bank Holiday and Christmas. 
2. The historic origins of Hallowe'en are outlined on the Historic UK: http://www.historic-uk.com/CultureUK/Halloween/
3. This link which outlines some risks and debunks some unfounded fears. http://content.time.com/time/nation/article/0,8599,1933329,00.html .  This holiday could promote safe driving to enable children be safe outside at all times of year.

attributes.action: Allow young people with 'controlled/managed' Asthma to join the Army.
attributes.background: Thousands of honest, dedicated young people have been denied recruitment to the Army simply for being diagnosed Asthmatic. Many young people who are physically fit and mentally capable are still being unfairly refused enrolment for receiving preventative treatment which keeps Asthma symptoms at bay
attributes.additional_details: Asthma is a life long condition that in many cases can be controlled/managed to the point where the sufferers symptoms have no effect on their daily life and activities. Thousands of young people are being unfairly denied the chance to defend their country and build themselves a solid and secure future simply because they receive preventative medication which keeps their Asthma symptoms at bay. This is unfair and outdated!

attributes.action: Tax on Premier League transfers to install and maintain free to use 4G pitches.
attributes.background: Introduce a tax on all Premier league transfers to raise funds to install and maintain 4G pitches in as many towns in England/Wales as possible that are free for kids/sports clubs/schools etc to use. Many children throughout England and Wales have to play football on inadequate pitches.
attributes.additional_details: Many football pitches are (water logged/on a hill/dangerous/ridden with dog muck) despite there being record breaking amounts of money in the English Premier league. £1.165bn spent to date this season already. Health of kids would increase from these pitches as would anti-social behaviour in communities. National football team would benefit as more children given opportunity to play on 'fit for purpose' pitches and fulfill their potential.

attributes.action: Give drink drivers an instant 4 week jail sentence if convicted to deter them.
attributes.background: In 2014 stats show that some 220 people were killed in crashes in which a driver was over the legal limit, 880 were seriously injured. Nearly 1 in 6 of all deaths on the road involve drivers who are over the legal alcohol limit. This is still too high and people still think it's OK to drink-drive.
attributes.additional_details: A total of 613,090 people were charged with drink driving during this period. 2004 - 2014. Statistics show that 595,093 (97%) of defendants charged were subsequently convicted while 17,997 (97%) were not convicted. Taken from drink driving.org
